data.title: James Rebhorn Dead: His Career in Pictures
data.meta_description: The busy character actor -- whose credits range from "Independence Day" and "Meet the Parents" to "White Collar" and "Homeland" -- died March 21 at age 65.
data.text:
‘Cat’s Eye’ (1985)

During his prolific five-decade career, the character actor had a slew of roles including one as "drunk businessman" opposite James Woods in this Stephen King-penned horror film, which also starred Drew Barrymore.

‘Independence Day’ (1996)

One of Rebhorn's most memorable performances was in this sci-fi action hit, in which he played Secretary of Defense Albert Nimzicki. He's pictured here at right with Brent Spiner, left, and Bull Pullman.

‘The Talented Mr. Ripley’ (1999)

Rebhorn played shipping magnate Herbert Greenleaf opposite Matt Damon, left, and Gwyneth Paltrow in this adaptation of Patricia Highsmith's novel.

‘Meet the Parents’ (2000)

Rebhorn had a supporting role as Dr. Larry Banks in this box-office hit, which also starred, from left, Phyllis George, Rebhorn, Thomas McCarthy, Nicole DeHuff, Robert De Niro, Teri Polo and Blythe Danner.

‘The Adventures of Rocky & Bullwinkle’ (2000)

Reborn played yet another politician, President Signoff, in this update of the classic animated series.

‘How to Eat Fried Worms’ (2006)

Rebhorn played "Boiler Head" opposite Luke Benward, center, and Adam Hicks in the adaptation of Thomas Rockwell's novel.

‘Royal Pains’ (2009)

Rebhorn guest-starred opposite Marc Feuerstein on season one of the USA Network series Royal Pains in 2009. He later reteamed with USA, landing a recurring role on White Collar as Special Agent Reese Hughes, head of the FBI's Manhattan white-collar crime unit.

‘The Odd Life of Timothy Green’ (2012)

Rebhorn, pictured with Dianne Wiest, had a role in this film opposite Jennifer Garner and Joel Edgerton.
